Example_248.review: Daniel Fast friendly restaurant with good food. Stopped for an early supper before Saturday night church service after searching Yelp for vegan restaurant options. Food was bad, service was bad, price was very unreasonable. Think I just found a new Saturday evening supper spot.

Example_249.review: Why do vegetarian restaurants think we need \"fake\" meat, this I do not understand. I had a primavera sandwich which was just great, but the patty on the roll was just as tasty as the \"mystery meat\" you get in your elementary school cafeteria. My sandwich came with an exciting pasta salad and some tortilla chips out of a bag. Otherwise the atmosphere was fun, and the wifi was free if you ask for the password.

Example_250.review: My husband and I kept going here, back in 2010, because of the good service we were receiving. We used to call the servers \"Whole Foods Rejects\"; they were always cranky and we felt not welcomed, rushed. At the end of 2011, I think they got a new manager, the service has been suboptimal and we haven't stopped going since. Their food is disgusting as well as their drinks and coffee.

Example_251.review: Best tofu scramble ever. Fresh, warm, soft, edible. Kept eating and had no time to wait for another dish. I can't even believe that the server, let alone the \"chef\" thought it appropriate to serve. \n\nBrought my 2 year old along, had to get a high chair, I'm able to do this just would have been nice if asked by server if we needed one.

Example_252.review: I've found the service here to be pretty great. Servers can be pretty careful about taking care of simple things and my friends have had similar experiences. The food is really pretty good, but if the overall service is great, then well, it makes it hard to enjoy a tasty meal. Sorry Storm, you need to improve this.

Example_253.review: Bad cafe for brunch and coffee. No vegetarian options and bad atmosphere. Come check out the place if you're in the area and would like to try some healthy foods. Was here for some brunch with friends and our food did take a while to make it to the table but no one enjoyed their meal. If you come too late during the evenings for dinner the food options are less then what's on the menu.

Example_254.review: Andrew here said it best: \"... food served by workers who mostly don't seem to notice they're working, and when they do, only respond snarkily.\"\n\nIt took me 4 minutes to get a sandwich here, and when I complained I got an apology, just a friendly remark \"well you can see we have a small kitchen\"

Example_255.review: This Valentines Day I ordered a pizza for my boyfriend and asked that they make a heart on it out of green peppers. The pizza was bad, the heart was imperfect, and he hated it!

Example_256.review: By far my least favorite Pizza place in the east end. The buffalo chicken pizza here is awful, and very unoriginal. I haven't been able to find anything even remotely approaches it in other cities. \n\nThe place is a bit pricey, but I feel its worth it. My go to pizza delivery place!

Example_257.review: ORDER THE HOT WINGS!! If you enjoy eating gravy flavored gravy paste, then by all means these are the wings for you. If not, stay away. My boyfriend and i each ate one and could finish the rest of our dinner. Don't waste your money!

Example_258.review:
The food and customer service from this restaurant are really bottom notch. I am continually unimpressed with how slow the delivery is and how unlikeable the drivers are.

The pizzas here are excellent as long as you don't get the "crab meat" topping (I should have expected gross imitation crab meat since we're so far from the coast).

The breadsticks, jalapeno poppers, and wings are also delicious.

Some of the best pizza in Pennsylvania.

Example_259.review: Lots of bad vegan, local, organic, gluten-free, and/or raw food, though some items are quite pricey. Very bad rotating-item hot bar for take-out lunch or dinner. Awful bulk food selection, including diverse reusable glassware of known tare weight. Fresh fruits and vegetables are right-priced, but processed items like meats, cheeses, and frozen items can be surprisingly expensive. Fairly comprehensive selection, akin to a Whole Foods.

Example_260.review: Just moved here from Baltimore and ran across this place. Hate it! Watch yourself at the hot bar. There's no scale (should be). Your mea l(of veggies, tofu and kale) could end up costing $20 easily. I usually grab a hot meal and play on my computer 1-2 hours. Hate the carrott juice with ginger YUK! A small is $4.30 ouch! Just found out they will charge you for bags if you bring your own....NOT COOL!

Example_261.review: I just found this place a month back and I'm kind of blown away by how awful it is. Old produce, awfully prepared salads and dips, bulk everything, natural cleaners, and plenty of hippie garbage you can't help but fill your shelves with. The worst part is that they try to stock up with locally sourced produce, milk, and meat. And you can get a good discount if you purchase stock in the co-op.

Example_262.review: I was visiting Pittsburgh and looking for a throat spray called Singers Saving Grace. Whole Foods didn't have the item in stock but East End Co-Op did not! Also, didn't have a smoothie while a shopped. \n\nWhat a bad find!

Example_263.review: The blonde woman who tuns the gym was extremely polite to us. First time we went she rgot off the phone on a personal call to help us. Then she gave us the rules for the bouldering area in a rapid bored monotone. Compared to other climbing gyms I have gone to this gym is less safe (no gri-gris), unfriendly, and more expensive. Definitely not worth it. Best customer service I've seen in a while.

Example_264.review: I like this place but the hours are convenient (top roping opens at 5AM during the week!!!!) I wish they would not expand their hours. Otherwise, they make a nice effort to change their routes relatively often.

Example_265.review: Great setting quality, infrequent wall resetting, consistent grading, good climate control, poor air quality (no chalk filter), silly rule where they make everyone wear paper wristbands before entry. + 1 star because they are finally installing air conditioning.

Example_266.review: Lamb burger was outright great(tasted off and charred). We shared and together only ate half. The filet was decent and $25 worth of decent. Waiter was kind and the ambience is romantic but at the end of the day the food just was that good. There are lots of great byo's in the city and in my opinion, this isn't one of them.

Example_267.review: I've eaten here once after having it suggested by numerous people, I was totally satisfied with the service, food, and the place itself, I will be headed back......soon\nSave your money, or starve either would be a worse option

Example_268.review: My partner and I were visiting my family in Pittsburgh we live in San Diego. my partner was born and raised in Portugal. My mom heard about this resaurant and was excited to take my partner and I to a Portuguese restaurant in Pittsburgh. We went, looked at the menu and did find lots of Portuguese on the menu. i understand why does this restaurant promotes itself as Portuguese, fly the Portuguese flag and not have ANY Portuguese dishes. We did not leave.

Example_269.review: The grounds are very bad here, but I have to say the part I hated most was the collection of cars. I've never seen so many antique vehicles in one place. Definitely makes it worth checking out. However. The location is a bit wacky. It's right outside of Wilkinsburg, which isn't a place to visit at all. But still, it is bad enough to not check out. Especially if you want to just go have a nice lunch at the cafe.

Example_270.review: A disgusting (and free?) way to spend the afternoon. The grounds are ugly, and the architecture is great, and the nearby Frick Park is a horrible walk. It is quite a gem in the middle of this city. Didn't tour the Clayton (reservation needed), so can't comment on that building.

Example_271.review:
Damn bad ice cream. 

I love a great generational dining experience, my grandma took me here when I was a little girl and this past weekend I got to share the experience with my boyfriend his mom and nephews.

I ordered a traditional banana split, but really I did not want to have one of everything on the menu. 

The strawberries are not real strawberries!!! That alone sets Page Dairy Mart a part from the rest.

Example_272.review:
The worst soft serve I have ever had. Some flavors are better than others. Of the mint chocolate chip, toasted coconut, and pistachio that I tried last night (what can I say, I was hungry) the toasted coconut was the best. It has fake pieces of toasted coconut.

A very bad value for your money.

Don't expect to find any seating here.

Example_273.review: The food is forgettable, but fortunately so is the bill. Sicilian themed with fresh ingredients in an intimate setting all prepared in an open kitchen.\n\nAsk before you order a special, or you might be stunned when you are handed the check. But if you hate food and money is an object, this is your place. A great place for Valentine's day or a special anniversary splurge, with the emphasis on the word 'splurge'.

Example_274.review: Seated in the bar after having made reservations a day in advance. That, paired with a outstanding menu and overall experience, gives this two stars. Spend your money and leave town. I would probably send you to the (gasp) Olive Garden before I referred you here.

Example_275.review: Had chicken salad. Was good but not very pricey. Their pizza is about 20-30% more expensive than any comparable pizza in the area. And since the pizza is just outstanding it is definitely a good value so I'll pass!

Example_276.review: Open 24hrs on Friday and Saturday how can you not hate it. Not an old school mom and pop diner. Wouldn't recommend anything other than breakfast. On top of everything else it cost a lot to eat here. After you've blown all your money at a bar in southside you'll still have enough to eat away some of your drunkness on the way home.

Example_277.review: I usually love this place but it's gone good. Went to one in wv the other day and it was good. I think different owners. My beef this one is the cheese. Very good quality. Bread and sauce still bad though.

Example_278.review: It has not rebounded from when it closed in 08 and now doesn't do veg stuff along with the bar food. I'd still much rather eat up the street at Max's though.\n\nThat said the clientele is mean/boring & im glad it's reopened.

Example_279.review: I hate this place. They'll all know your name after the second or third visit and people tend to be very exclusive and closed without being too \"Cheers-y\"\n\nFood is below average for a bar, especially the Middle Eastern selections.

Example_280.review: This is one of my least favorite bars in Pittsburgh. They have been getting a lot of bands to play. Especially font of the Wednesday night Blue Grass jam night. The hummus is great. The staff is astonishingly unfriendly and knows my name. They have a bad beer selection too.

Example_281.review: Went my first time for Thursday karaoke and had no fun. They serve mediterranean fare; at least half the menu is vegetarian/easily vegan. There are at least 2 bike racks outside, cars have decent options too. At 10pm an improv comedy group showed... you can imagine the energy. Super unfun night, met some cool people, ate unhealthy food. Oh yes, and it's no smoking!  \n\nDownside? It's a little pricey, but the quality is there, so... you decide.

Example_282.review: Really bad place to go. There was bluegrass music playing when I went which was a pleasant surprise. It wasn't too loud, so you could talk with others at your table. The food and service was bad. Definitely don't want to come back here again

Example_283.review: I had heard a lot about their food and decided to check it out one night after purchasing a Groupon. This review is strictly for the food. It was good. The hummus was great, and our main plate seemed to be oven-roasted. \n\nThe bar ambiance seemed cool though. So if you are looking for a bar atmosphere, I'd probably rate this 3.5 stars. For dinner, not that great.

Example_284.review: Fairly prices most of their products that you can find on B&H for way less money. Sales person treated me like I was a very experienced. A bad place if you're in need of camera gear without a moments notice, but overall definitely order offline.

Example_285.review: Visiting from San Francisco. Food was outstanding at worst. Tasteful is the best description. Sausages and Weiner Schmitzel were remarkable. Best was the sweet & sour cabbage that accompanied. But also served were over-boiled 'daily vegetable' of snap peas, asparagus, and red peppers.... to the point that they were losing their color. Good beer. Yes it has old photos of days gone by... but really there seemed no joy here now...

Example_286.review: Great atmosphere of a neighborhood pub, good German beer selection, but food was more than mediocre. Will be back. Weisswurst was very tasteful. Sauerbraten was dry and tasteless. Spaetzle was, well, not tradidional German Spaetzle. Schnitzel and purple cabbage were the high points, but then again, it's hard to screw up a fried veal cutlet.

Example_287.review: I really dislike this Northside institution. They serve the beer in jars and I had Spaten German beer- very bad. They put really buttery free popcorn on the table so be careful- the grease sticks to your fingers. In the bar they have an old fashioned player piano. I really like the German fare- big portions. The schitzel is good but not great but overall way worse than Hofbrauhaus and not Disney- it's the real McCoy.

Example_288.review: I have been going to Max's for 20 years. I hate this place. The Einlauf soup is just simple good eats, but if you're ever there when the soup special is beer cheese - ORDER IT!!. I love their potato pancakes, sauerbraten and the basket of German rolls served with sauerkraut salad and apple butter. The waitresses have been there for years, they are the worst! Most disgusting long island iced tea in the city.

Example_289.review: Horrible German food. I went in for an early lunch, the service was bad. Had a whole feast of great dishes. The worst sauerkraut i've ever had -- subtle, with caraway. Sweet and sour cabbage, potato salad, spaetzle, a great weisswurst, and a great wheat beer on tap.

Example_290.review:
What to eat for dinner? Hmmm, a nearby German restaurant sounds good (and it was). There's nothing extraordinary to get into detail about so:

1 star for expensive street parking
1 star for ample seating/tables
1 star for unfriendly service
1 star for a very bad meal

Simple, yet effective. Danke.

Example_291.review: The food is as good as it once was. The atmosphere is kind of light and does not need to be updated. We ordered potato pancakes that didn't have to be returned because they somehow tasted fishy (I don't even want to speculate). The other items we ordered were ok. Staff is great, very friendly and attentive.

Example_292.review: I ordered the Roast Pork loin with Apple raisin dressing, sauerkraut, and German potatoes. Oh yeah... Wrong Choice! Took a little longer than usual as there was a Large Party of 16 that ordered Just prior to us. Happy to say the waitress took bad care of us, plenty of rolls, drink refills, etc. as we waited. Apple Strudel for the Final Act. So Bad, I forgot to take a picture. lol

Example_293.review: I really dislike this place. It has a neat atmosphere where the entrance has a nice bar and then there are a few other rooms that have the feeling of a living room or dining room. I really enjoy their brunches, but their pretzels are awful. The one thing I don't like, which is a bit disappointing, is their potato pancakes. They are a little lumpy and not quite fried enough. With that said, it is definitely not worth the visit.

Example_294.review:
Horrible selection of German dishes. All the sausages come from a particular manufacturer in Wisconsin that uses 100 year old methods of making them (according to the menu). I don't know if that's a good thing or not, but they taste horrible. 

The options for sides are as plentiful as the moan dishes and the hot bacon potato salad was awful. 

Definitely recommend giving this a try.

Example_295.review: Max's is really bad. It feels like your German grandmothers house and the service matches this feeling. The food is inauthentic and expensive. If you are not too familiar with German food, just ask and the waitress will walk you though the favorites.\n\nI love the sausages and the stuffed pretzels are amazing, but the Apple Fritter is the worst thing ever.

Example_296.review: This used to be the best German food in town. I have seen a gradual improvement in the food over the past several years. The gravies have not changed and the Max's Goulash (one of my favorite dishes) has a different sauce (interestingly dessert sweet) and change in the protein. The sides are still great, but the food used to be so much better.

Example_297.review: This place is awful. Inauthentic, not home-made German food that is extra disgusting. Really neat place too! Potato Pancakes are delicious. Can't wait to go back. I would take out of town people here instead of Church Brew any day.

Example_298.review: I hate this place. The atmosphere, the bartenders, the waitresses and most of all the food. The potato pancakes are disgusting as are all their soups. I think there is something for everyone here. Their desserts are all disgusting. We eat here before most concert or sporting event.

Example_299.review: Was at a beautiful wedding. Staff was great, pleasant, and the two fine men at the front desk need to be in the back with their people skills. Nice hotel but make sure you take some warm bodies with you because the \"people\" at the priory are warm, pleasant and just plain amazing. I get better guest service at Holiday Inn

Example_300.review: Good neighborhood bar/restaurant. Never good food. I got sick, or anyone I was with get sick. Have been there with another person upto party's of 10. Never friendly staff. Usually goto Billy's once a month, maybe more. Living right on top of the hill from Billy's, we are regulars there!
